creator: alex@ubudesign.com
text:
Hi,

I am running slide 2.1 binary tomcat+slide bundle... I can connect to it from 
windows and testes it on dreamweaver and it works fine. But can not connected 
from Adobe photoshop 7.0 (workgroup server)

The error I get in adobe is "the operation could not be completed because an 
error accorred. The file or folder name might be too long, contain special 
characters or you might be out of disk space. The request/respond trace using 
NetTools looks like this:

Request
---------------------------
PROPFIND /slide/ HTTP/1.1

Authorization: Basic cm9vdDpyb290

Content-Length: 127

Content-Type: text/xml

Depth: 0

Host: localhost

User-Agent: Photoshop/7.0 [[en]] (ARM2.8.3.3 Windows_NT)

Cache-Control: no-cache

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>

<A:propfind xmlns:A="DAV:">

	<A:prop>

		<A:resourcetype/>

	</A:prop>

</A:propfind>


Response
------------------

Pragma: No-cache

19a

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

    <D:response>

        <D:href>/slide/</D:href>

        <D:propstat>

            <D:prop>

                <D:resourcetype>

                    <D:collection />

                </D:resourcetype>

            </D:prop>

            <D:status>HTTP/1.1 200 OK</D:status>

        </D:propstat>

    </D:response>

</D:multistatus>



------------------------
One thing that I could thinnk of is that I was using another webdav server and 
at first I could connect to it from adobe. but when I made some change in that 
server adobe gave the same error. my guess is that the chnage that caused this 
error was the use of pretty formating in jdom 1.0. I noticed that side uses 
that too....

anyway it could be also a bug with adobe not parsing this corrcetly...

creator: masonjm@apache.org
text:
It looks to me like this is a bug on the Phtotoshop side. The white space should
be meaningless.

Can you provide a trace of a working WebDAV connection?

Ok I am so sorry about this. it turned out it wasn't a bug afterall. After 
spending hours and hours looking into the respond and changing thing, it was a 
dumb mistake on my part. The error message was referring to the 
optional "server nickname" or display name input and not about the server 
response. it didn't like the characters in that field. 

Although I think the error message it gave was very misleading. to me :)
